The ability of EPS to chelate iron (II) sulphate (FeSO 4) was determined using methods described by Puntel et al. (2005) with little modification. Briefly, 150 mM FeSO 4 was added to a reaction mixture containing 168 μl of 0.1M Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 218 μl saline (0.9% NaCl) and EPS (100 μl) of different concentrations (100–200 μg/ml). The reaction mixture was incubated at 27 °C for 5min, before the addition of 13 μl of 0.25% 1, 10-phenantroline (w/v) and the absorbance was subsequently measured at 510 nm in the spectrophotometer.
